intro: Hieracium divisum var. tenerum, commonly known as the softleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of soft, hairy leaves that become more upright as the plant matures. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. This variant is distinguished by its more tender, fleshy leaves compared to other varieties of Hieracium.
